values: Just in case anyone's wondering, I'm not going to be online for a while, I'm trying to get my soul back from the devil.  So if you need me, pick up the phone.

So yeah, i'm stuck in Randolph til after the evvys.  There's no avoiding it.  The commute sucks, but its worth the good sleeping I guess.  I'm feeling alot better, definitely could be better, but its not too bad.  At least my "dazed and dizzy feeling" has subsided, so I can concentrate more on my web shite.  I feel so disconnected from everyone else though. Just wanted to let you all know that I miss you guys, but I'll see you soon!... ish.

Oh well, back to work.
I post this.

I'm gonna tell you about my town
I'm gonna tell you a big bad story, baby
Aww, it's all about my town
Yeah, down by the river
Down by the banks of the river Charles (aw, that's what's happenin' baby)
That's where you'll find me
Along with lovers, fuggers, and thieves (aw, but they're cool people)
Well I love that dirty water
Oh, Boston, you're my home (oh, you're the number one place)
Frustrated women (I mean they're frustrated)
Have to be in by twelve o'clock (oh, that's a shame)
But I'm wishin' and a-hopin, oh
That just once those doors weren't locked (I like to save time for my baby to walk around)
Well I love that dirty water
Oh, Boston, you're my home (oh, yeah)
Because I love that dirty water
Oh, oh, Boston, you're my home (oh, yeah)
Well, I love that dirty water (I love it, baby)
I love that dirty water (I love Baw-stun)
I love that dirty water (Have you heard about the Strangler?)
I love that dirty water (I'm the man, I'm the man)
I love that dirty water (Owww!)
I love that dirty water (Come on, come on)


Oh how sweet it is.  What a weekend, what a game.

Because there are people I love and respect, this entry has been deleted.

I'm saddened, not by having to change this entry, but just by the fact that a few words encoded in cyberspace by a tired and stressed person, that weren't intentionally personal, could have such a huge effect.

I appologize to those offended, and I hope we're not all becoming consumed by voiceless, unbacked internet blogs that in no way show who we really are.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qHO8l-Bd1O4
Bill: What's that? Steve: It's an iHouse! Bill: But there's no windows! Steve: EXACTLY!
Plus if you really want to know, you should ask me. So, that said... My new use for the lj. Enjoy!

Works for me.

2 papers down, 2 projects to go


*death in t-minus 4 days*

I am so burnt out, yet I'm no where close to done...

*cries, recovers, trudges on*

*rinse and repeat if necessary*

You know somethings wrong when you think you've been resting for an hour or so, when in reality you've only been sitting there for 10 minutes.

Slightly stressed out.

Only slightly.

*sparks fly from head*

*twitch*

So, I'm back in Randolph for Thanksgiving, and I have to admit I'm enjoying being home.

One thing that makes me really happy is that my Dad doesn't have to work all day tomorrow like we originally thought, so we'll actually get to have the family together on thanksgiving after all.  I'm really glad, because I miss that.  And some of my extended family will be here too, which is also happy.  

Random thought, but I thought I'd mention it.  While being here, it made me realize how much I want my own house.  Where I can decorate how I want, furnish how I want, run things how I want, keep things neat and clean (other than my room, the rest of the house would be spotless, that i  can promise).  Doesn't even have to be big, even a little cottage sized place.  Just a place that's mine, where I can do what i want too and stuff.  That would be nice.  Like I said, random thought, but I thought I'd share.

In the meantime, I'm looking forward to more food tomorrow.  Yay!

Friggin WERS ruining my plans...

Looks like I'm going to have to leave the apartment tonight for thanksgiving in order to make this week work.

YAY for not having time for life!!!!!
I just got a craving for salami.  Is that weird?

Would anyone want to go see Deftones with me December 1st?

Tickets be 26 bucks.

(yay first lj post in forever!!!)

I hurt lots.  Thank you work for making me bend down repeatedly hundreds (litterally) of times and making me assist in the tackle of a psycho (Yeah, this guy went a little berserk at the Iron Maiden concert tonight, and I was involved in running him down and restraining him until the cops came). But it was a rewarding evening 8-)

My camera comes on Monday, I cannot wait!  Anyone need headshots?

Ok, bedtime.  Night night go seep.
So, I just bought this a few minutes ago... Hot damn!

So, I know I haven't updated in a really long time, so I thought I'd give a little update as to my brain status...

Classes started today, and I had just one, my intro to visual arts class.  It seems blah, but I'm hoping it will improve.  I am looking forward to classes tomorrow though, should be awesome.  Got some hours back at the photo lab, and I start again next week.  THAT is also awesome.

So I ended up spending the last three weeks, minus perhaps two or three days with Lauren.  The summer without her was pretty harsh, but I'm so glad she's back.  We did lots the past few weeks.  Spent lots of time with the extended Emerson family, did a little partying, visited Cape Cod, Castle Island, and even Randolph.  I haven't gushed in a while, so I think I will right now...  I love my Lauren, and it felt SOOO good to spend that much time with her.  I left her apartment a little over an hour ago, and as soon as the door shut and I started walking back toward the T, it felt like a little part of me was left behind.  I know I'm gonna see her again tomorrow, but it's just kind of a strange empty feeling.  I started teaching her to cook and she made chicken parm pretty much entirely herself, and I was so proud :-D  Ok, I know this sounds ridiculous, but I enjoyed it.  I love my Lauren.  I love where I am in life, and I like where things seem to be going.

I can't wait for more to come.

Boston Massacre 2006.

Almost makes me ashamed to work for the Sox.  Honestly, who gets swept 5 games at home?

Grrrrr.

So I got through today, but there's no way in hell I'm going anywhere tomorrow.

Yeah, I've got a fever on top of everything, this ain't no allergy (dammit).

Oh well... seepy time.

Ugh.  I feel like absolute shit.

Seriously, who gets a cold in the friggin summer!!??!?
Apparently I do.
Damn it.

And now I'm off to work a double at Fenway... in the rain....

This is going to be wonderful :-(

Alright, 3am...

Need to be up in 4 hours

lets try this sleep thing again

(hopes next post will be after i wake up)

So remember everything I said in the entry I posted a few hours ago?  Yeah, I'd give all of that up in a heartbeat if it meant I wouldn't feel like shit like I do right now.

And don't ask what's wrong, because I don't know.

Fuck, I just wish I could sleep at the moment.

So, last night I met David Ortiz and Curt Schilling while I was at work.  I got to sprawl out on the outfield grass at Fenway, groped the green monster, and my sneakers are now covered in warning track dirt (which are never being worn again).  Oh, and I caught my first foul ball ever today.

Dude, I love my job.

(Did I mention I'll be at 3 out of the 5 Sox/Yankees games this coming weekend???)
Ok, maybe there is a glimmer of faith left...

Sox lost again

As far as I'm concerned, the season is over.

Better luck next year.

Haven't posted in a while, and I'm bored, so...

I really hate just sitting around and "standing by," if you will.  
I absolutely hate not being able to do anything.
I hate it I hate it I hate it.

Lauren von Hagel, I am so completely in love with you.  These past 4 months have been nothing but incredible, and I can't wait until I can finally be with you again.  

And believe me, no crazy landlady will stand a chance if she gets in my way ;-)




(and on a completely different note)
Hmmm, that's the second time I "saw stars" today...

I'm glad I'm getting my eyes checked soon.

LAUREN COMES HERE TODAY!!!!

Less than 24 hours to go!!!

Must sleep, prepare, WOOOOOOOOOOOOOT!!!!!

Hehe, The Hebrew Hammer rocks ass.

Work was good tonight.  Thank goodnes the rain held off, and we didn't get our balls soaked.  However came home to find we have no hot water.  Landlord's gonna try and get a plummer over here tomorrow and get the pilot light started again.  Grrr.  Cold showers in the morning!

Umm, yeah, nothing else much to say. Lauren's here in 5 days though!!! CAN"T FRIGGIN WAIT!!!  I really hope someone will cover my work shift Friday night.  More grrr on that note.

G'night.

I am tired, and don't exactly want to go to work, but would rather be asleep, seeing that it cooled off DRASTICALLY over night and is extremely comfortable right now. Like, want to pull up a blanket comfortable.  After work though, I'm headed to Randolph until Friday, mainly so I can build the bookcase I want for my room, and so I can take advantage of the pool.

I'm hungry... why didn't we buy bagels yesterday?

I AM SO INSANELY IN LOVE WITH LAUREN VON HAGEL!!!!



Just putting that out there, that is all.

Hehehe, I love thunderstorms.  I think I actually feed off the electrical energy from the storm itself, I always feel so energized during and after one.  I hope it brings some cooler air with it.  The air got pretty oppressive this morning, that should be taken care of somewhat.

Anyway, I promised an update the other day, so here we go.  So Dave Matthews Band played at Fenway this past weekend, and I was working both the Friday and Saturday concerts.  I didn't stay Friday, but Saturday I stayed to watch the show.  Which was awesome, hugely because I was standing right in front of the friggin' stage!  When I went into work that morning, I bumped into a guy that I work with at my other security job, and who I also worked with last year at Gillette.  But after talking with him after a bit he agreed to get me on the field when I was finished with work, technically Fenway employees weren't allowed to be there unless they were actually working, so I found my little connection quite useful.  8-)   So it was pretty friggin awesome.

I'm pretty content with July so far, though I wish it could go by faster.  Mainly because my Lauren is coming up at the end of the month!!!!  I really can't wait, and I think I've got a pretty nice weekend planned for us.  She sent me roses the other day, and they were absolutely gorgeous, which made my heart melt.  She makes my heart melt every day though, merely by existing.

Well, I'm working RemDawg's All-Star party at Fenway tonight, so who knows who I'm going to be meeting there (although this means I miss Rescue Me *sadness*).  But it should be wicked fun.  My sister's birthday is Thursday, so I'm probably going to visit her or something.  I also have a bookcase to build for my room, which should be happening sometime in the near future.  Thursday???  Who knows.  All I know is I want this summer to be over, Lauren to be back, and things to get back into action.

So I just had a dream about sunlit nights, and flying kayaks...

This is gonna be a long day.






And I promise I'll give an actual update one of these days.

Absolutely amazing.



On so many levels.

So, when was I thinking I was going to get film for tomorrow, cuz it's not happening tomorrow morning, and I failed to do that today...

Wow, I slacked on that one.  Oh well, I guess tomorrow is all digital.

*sad face*

I am really not happy now.  This completely sucks.  Everyone I know is out enjoying themselves tonight and I just had to get sick somehow, keeping me alone in the apartment, and of course I'm watching a shitload of ghost shows that's kinda creeping me out... ESPECIALLY NOW THAT THE POSTER BEHIND ME JUST FELL OFF THE FUCKING WALL!!!

Can this summer be over, like, now???

Yes, that was me in the center field bleacher section leading a good 2,000+ Sox fans in "Sweet Caroline"...

I love my job 8-)





now if the Sox can just win this thing...

EDIT:  took 12 innings, but we won!!  Thank you Papi, thank you.

So I think I'm just gonna use this to keep my head clear for a while...

Tomorrow afternoon (provided no thunderstorms) I'll be on the river.

Saturday its back to Randolph for the weekend, with a much needed haircut first on the priority list.

Monday its back to Fenway, and Tuesday its finalization of job number 2.

*sigh*

EDIT:  Some people deserve to get hit by a bus.  Just putting that out there.
There's so much I want to say, so, so much. I have no idea where to start, or how to say it. So I'm just gonna post this bunny with a pancake on its head... ...it's a start.
Very happy visit to my Lauren!  Long update coming after a long sleep :)

I'm gonna be in Maryland from now til Sunday...

*explodes with awesomeness*

I hurt.  But it's so worth it!

So, not even a week later, I've passed my rigging test, and solo exam, meaning I've successfully earned my solo rating, meaning I can now take out a sailboat and sail solo whenever the hell I want! That, plus I decided yesterday to go ahead get kayak certified, so now I can kayak too! And I did!  Hence today's soreness, but so awesome, I did it again today.  :)   Essentially, I found what I'll be doing for the rest of the summer.

And now I'm so friggin' excited, because I see my Lauren THE DAY AFTER TOMORROW!!!!  Yes, that required all caps.  Oh man, I can't wait!  Fly down wednesday night, won't be back til late sunday.  It's going to be amazing!

*does happy excited dance*

Who's gonna be sailing all day tomorrow?

Oh yeah...  me!

Ok, its only been one day, but I'm already sick of this weather.

I worked today, and I figured I'd be able to leave early, considering there was 100% chance of heavy rain all friggin' day long.  Well, that didn't happen, because people kept coming for tours!  And if there are tours, well, we are there.  So basically, what today amounted to, was getting absolutely soaked once every three hours all day.  It was, however, rather amusing, and we had a good time fucking around in the souvenir shop in between soakings.  So, even though I came home freezing my ass off and completely soaked, it was all fun times.  Rest assured, I took a nice long hot shower as soon as I got home.

Backtracking to yesterday... a fantastic day!  I finally returned two books to the BPL that were about three months overdue.  After that I walked over to Tealuxe, where I got some iced tea and continued to walk over to, and along the Charles River.  It was such a gorgeous day and I really envied those who were in boats on the river.  So much so, that when I passed by the boat house, I was very careful as to make note of the website posted on a sign outside the place (more coming on this story later).  Upon returning home, I took care of some stuff I've been meaning to do for awhile, such as splitting our cable line, giving myself more electrical outlets in my room, doing laundry, finding a certain jacket, and setting up my cyanotyping exposure box.  After doing all that (very successfully I may add), I went in search of the website I had found earlier.  After pondering it over for a bit, I decided that I'm going to get a membership to the boathouse and learn to sail!  Tomorrow I'll be going back to inquire further in person, but its gonna happen!  And its so friggin AWESOME!

And of course, at this time next week, I'LL BE BACK WITH MY LAUREN!!!!!!!!!!!   :-D

*does excited happy dance*
